data.approach: Update Configuration section to explain subscription-based auth as primary method, API keys as optional. Remove impression that API keys are required. Add Agent Authentication section explaining the fallback chain.

summary: Added new Authentication section explaining subscription-based auth as primary method
Updated Configuration section: API keys marked as optional, removed google/openai from example
Clarified auto-fallback system: API key if configured, CLI subscription as fallback
Added agent auth table showing setup commands for each supported agent
reviewFocus: Verify auth section accurately reflects the LLM service fallback chain
Check credentials.json example is appropriately minimal

suggestedTasks.title: Create Authentication Setup Guide for Developers
suggestedTasks.description: Develop a comprehensive authentication setup guide with step-by-step instructions for implementing the new subscription-based authentication mechanism. Include screenshots, configuration examples, and troubleshooting tips for common setup scenarios. Target audience is external developers integrating the service.
suggestedTasks.reason: Ensure clear developer onboarding for new authentication method

suggestedTasks.title: Implement Authentication Method Environment Validation
suggestedTasks.description: Create a validation mechanism to check authentication configuration during service startup. Develop helper functions that verify subscription credentials, validate environment variables, and provide clear error messages if authentication setup is incomplete or misconfigured.
suggestedTasks.reason: Improve reliability and user experience of authentication setup
